titleStmt.title: E. W. Martin and Hugh Means, Affidavit
CWG5614

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
State and Commonwealth of Kentucky
Jefferson County and Circuit Sct.

October Term of the Jefferson Circuit Court in the year of Our Lord One Thousand eight Hundred and Sixty. The jurors of the Grand Jury impannelled and sworn to inquire in and for ^the^ body of the County of Jefferson in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky in their oath present that John Breckinridge late of said County laborer on the First day of September in the year eighteen hundred and Sixty in the said County of Jefferson and State of Kentucky with force and arms Feloniously had and kept in his possession certain false and forged counterfeit Bank notes purporting to be payable by the Bank of Ashland a Bank duly incorporated by Law in the United States in the words and figures as follows "To Wit." The Bank of Ashland Kentucky will pay at their office at Shelbyville to Bearer Ten Dollars on demand Ashland Jany 1 1857.

{ E. W. Martin Cashr.
Hugh Means Prest.

And are other forged & counterfeit Bank not purposting to be payable by the Bank of Ashland a Bank duly incorporated by Law in the United States in the numbers & Figures as follows
To Wit" The Bank of Ashland Kentucky will pay at their office at Shelbyville to bearer Ten Dollars on demand Ashland Jany 1. 1857

E. W. Martin Cashr.
Hugh Means Presd.

He the said John Breckinridge well knowing the same to be forged and counterfeit with the intent of circulating the same Contray to the form of the Statute in that case made and provided and against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky
E. S Craig Atty for Commonwealth 7th Ju Dis.

Witnesses for Commonwealth
Wm R. Ray
Jo Sweeny
Alex Cross
Gus Hatzel
A Copy Att
Wm. H. Slaughter Clk
By Robt Murphy D. C

(A)
Shelby Circuit Ct.
Commonwealth
vs } Indictment for Having in possession counterfeit money with intent to circulate the same
John Breckinridge
John Breckinridge
A True Bill
Thos Quigley Foreman
A Copy Att
Wm. H. Slaughter ck
By Robt. Murphy
Refused
